Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for rest”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel for rest, good situation for business trip, nice breakfast and good service. Big and comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value for Money, But Probably Not for Tourists”
Reviews.Author: Trotamundos09
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend in early July. I lived in Madrid, so know the city well, and know that this hotel is nowhere near the main sights, but not too far from public transit and the Avenida de Americas terminal for Metro, buses, and inter-city buses. Front Desk staff spoke some English, even though I spoke Spanish to them. Rooms were fine though not huge, with nice modern furniture and strong A/C, essential for summer in Madrid. No views to speak of besides the apartments across the street. The free mini-bar of soft drinks and water came in handy, and you could go down to the lounge for free wi-fi even if you did not have breakfast or order food/drinks. At the rate I got -- which seemed to be their normal rate -- I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if your executive status...Please...No Platinum Marriot Perks”
Reviews.Author: EllyDeyhle
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel on a last minute whim. With marriot status we were able to book a great rate the night before. We were driving in from France and making a one night stop over in Madrid before our London departure....BIG MiSTAKE. Being the nieve Americans that we are we decided that the new AC collection by Marriot would be up to the standards of other Marriots...no it was not. Where do I begin besides the fact that I was terrified of having my luggage stolen off the street curb( ok maybe I was just paranoid) but it seemed a little sketchy. If you are a tourist or even a business traveler this location is in a very residential part of town. My room had pull down metal chains over the window and I choose to keep them closed to avoid my view of the neighbors drying laundry rack. Oh and the burglar bars come in handy because their is NO hotel safe. However, if you have some extreme valuables that you can't risk loosing you can store them at the check-in counter for a mere 10 euros. If you enjoy working out then avoid, they actually put a treadmill in an empty room and declared it a workout facility. When we decided that the Fanta in the mini bar would not do... we ventured out.... to a world of nothing. A mediocre pizza place down the street was our only option. However, the streetwalkers advised us of the china shop across the street where we could buy everything from special k cereal to a fake iPod. We decided to save for breakfast. We ne er quite made it to breakfast because the street noise was unbearable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, OK for business”
Reviews.Author: OsborneWork
Reviews.Content: The hotel is somehow connected with the Marriott chain but better known as AC hotel to the taxi driver at the airport. The hotel is located in a small side street between the airport and the town center, close to a Metro station. I came late in the evening and the road was very quiet, however in the morning it was jammed with traffic. The room I liked very much, a symphony of wood and marble with a view directly over the street. The area is mostly residential but does contain a number of bars and restaurants. Breakfast had a limited selection of fruit, cheeses and ham - but was of a very good quality. The staff were friendly and the process efficient.

Reviews.Title: “It's nice......”
Reviews.Author: moijolitravel
Reviews.Content: I plan to stay here for business for a over a week, and there are some items that already bother me. Overall, the rooms are modern and very clean. I happen to disagree with someone's comment about not complaining b/c the staff does not speak English. I travel internationally every few months and have been to Spain on several occasions, and this hotel was one of the worst experiences when trying to communicate to perform basic tasks, such as checking-in, ordering room services, or asking for some towels. Other than that, the experience has been nice, but I will also be staying at another hotel when I return for business here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and very friendly staff !”
Reviews.Author: Yaka D
Reviews.Content: Very modern and clean. near the Metro. staff was very helpfully. very good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for Jesus Fernandez at the front desk-He is the best!”
Reviews.Author: lmganfield
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at the AC on business, been here for 5 days, Jesus Fernandez at the main desk in the afternoons is the best. He has made our stay very pleasurable. He is by far the friendliest and most professional of all the staff we have encountered. Since our first day he has been a gracious host providing us with outstanding directions to many of Madrid's tourist sites. The rooms are pleasant, but be sure you are not on the street side as they can get very noisy. Rooms are clean and beds are comfortable. You do hear a lot of banging when doors are open and closed because of all the hard surfaces, bring ear plugs if you are a light sleeper. The lounge has free internet, and serves reasonably priced food. The grilled chicken with vegetables is a good choice if you are on a restricted diet. The food is served even when the local restaurants are closed. The metro is about a 10 minute walk. The metro is very safe to use. I was traveling alone when my husband was on business. People in Spain are not that friendly so don't expect much help on the streets or in stores. Do your research ahead of time so you don't stand out as a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Marriott Standards”
Reviews.Author: ip241au
Reviews.Content: Stayed four days at the AC Hotel Avenida de America in February 2012. Arrived by car and there is not a place to park to drop off bags. Called them to see if they had hourly rates for parking in their garage and they didn't (wanted a place to park briefly to drop off bags). Clerk that checked us in was on the phone the whole time and spoke to us once. He seemed too busy to greet us. Also, they did not have a luggage cart (we had several bags). One elevator was out of order for two of our four days. Stayed in standard room on fifth floor. Walls were paper thin. Very busy and noisy street made it difficult to get sleep. Room service was prompt in the morning for coffee and was reasonably priced. Had dinner one night in the restaurant and it was good but overpriced. Service was prompt. Internet was free in the lounge area, but wireless in the room was 12 euros for 24 hours. Location is close to the Avenida de America Metro/Bus station. Some shops and restaurants within walking distance. The price for the room was reasonable. When I go back to Madrid, I'll probably find another hotel more centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, area is OK”
Reviews.Author: insulaner1984
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for two nights over new years' eve, had a great rate for a superior room and really enjoyed the room, which had a seperate seating area and two TVs, one for the bed, one for the sofa. Room was clean and hotel quiet - I don't think many guests were staying there. Didn't have any food at the hotel. Location is OK, I don't mind some steady walks, for those seeking a central location, this would not be your first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel--reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: uswmnj
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel multiple times and what I like best is the size of the room. For the rate (because out of the center but metro 5 min away), you can't beat it. The rooms are also clean and comfortable. Not too many restaurants nearby but take the short metro ride into the center for lots of options. Staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Alright, not Great”
Reviews.Author: Drroady
Reviews.Content: There are many far superior hotels to choose from in this category. Having just come from an AC Marriott property in Malaga, I was terribly disappointed. Checkin was a chore, checkout even worse. There were two guys at the front desk, both of them on the phone for what seemed an eternity before assisting those of us in the ever growing line. Truthfully, it crossed my mind I might miss my flight over their inattentiveness. The 16.50 Euro breakfast was the biggest disappointment and joke I've seen in my years of travel. the "buffet" consisted of cold bread and cheese, limited selection of fruit and cold cereal. I had one small piece of bread/cheese and hot tea. for Euro 16.50? Please, it was worth perhaps $1. My room was considerably smaller than the one I had in Malaga, even though I'd booked the same type of room. My window overlooked the back of a building, complete with drying laundry hanging out the windows across the street. I'll be back in Madrid this week and have booked another property.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent For A 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: Gaurav M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a month Dec and Jan and it was like a second home. The staff were friendly, rooms really nice, very close to the metro station ( Walking 5 mins). Free internet is offered only in the coffee shop but it was quite good and always available. Rooms were quite spacious and cozy. If I am back would love to stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good amenities, not ideal location”
Reviews.Author: TravelingAuntA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2011 because it turned out the hotel we originally booked was in the middle of the Plaza de la Puerta del Sol protests. We felt it was important to have some quiet at night, especially at the very beginning of our trip. This hotel was very clean, and modern, and had some nice amenities -- including the free mini-bar with soft drinks that was replenished daily. Lemon fanta fix! Also the beds were incredibly comfortable. The staff were friendly, and helpful (and we came just as this place was switching over to Marriott so we heard some about that). We also got an excellent price, even at the last minute. The location was ok - certainly doable, especially if you are comfortable navigating public transportation and/or are willing to pay for a taxi. It probably took about 35-40 minutes to get from the hotel to the Prado for example, if you took the metro. We mostly did that, although one night we took a cab which was reasonable because we split it four ways. We did not eat the breakfast because it seemed pretty expensive. We didn't spend much time in the neighborhood. It was certainly safe there, but we had trouble picking out a place to eat. Probably if we spoke better Spanish, or had known we were coming here further in advance the food situation would have been fine. Overall, I might go back here if it was an incredible deal again, but would probably try to stay closer to the downtown if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, far from downtown Madrid”
Reviews.Author: notsohappyDenver
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel, but it was far from downtown Madrid. And ten minutes to the train station. Breakfast was extra & pricey. Free Internet was good.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice. Clean and modern.”
Reviews.Author: roscoe_love
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights in July. The hotel was very clean, modern and newly built. Front-desk staff were friendly, helpful and their english was good enough. Soft drinks and water in the mini-bar in the room were free. Room was spacious, had great black out shutters and curtains for a nice dark room at night. Room was equipped with air conditioning and TV. Bathroom was lovely and large with new facilities. Free wifi in the lobby was good though free wifi throughout the hotel would have been more convenient. Breakfast buffet was expensive at €16. The hotel is situated a bit out of town but was in a safe area with shops and cafes nearby. It took us about 30-40 minutes to walk to the Prado Museum but there are train stations close to the hotel if you didn't want to walk. It was a very comfortable stay. We really liked this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “poor location”
Reviews.Author: sixpack22
Reviews.Content: Hotel was good but ugly neighbourhood and too distant from city. No WI FI in the room , only in lobby. Tip: if flying from America be aware of the next morning's oversleep. You might miss breakfast and there isn't a nice place nearby to go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern, clean and comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: SamGorchuk
Reviews.Content: Very modern, clean and comfortable rooms. Although not in the centre of Madrid it is located very close to the metro making it easy to get around Madrid. I would definitely stay here again. It has air conditioning and a refrigerator.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quality hotel - would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Naths81
Reviews.Content: Nice comfortable hotel - was there with my boyfriend for a long weekend - and it was perfect for our needs. The hotel is not in the centre of town - but really close to a metro where it takes 5-10 mins to get to sol or to opera, where the Royal palace is located. You can easily walk into town, which we did for the first day and you walk through where all the people of Madrid shop and eat. The hotel is not full of tourists - and neither are the surroundings, It costs about 18 euros in a cab to the airport and when you finish in town late, it costs about 10 euros back to the hotel. Being a Londoner - that is very cheap in my eyes. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel, because generally hotel breakfasts are extortionately expensive for what they give you, but we went to a cafe around the corner, which was ideal! Good trip - hotel was fine - free mini bar (soft drinks) which is restocked every day! Only thing that I would change would be to have free wifi in the room - other than that - Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “bad value to money”
Reviews.Author: eugeita
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms full equiped, with modern restroom. Expensive wi-fi inside the rooms, for free just at the reception, simply absurd in 2011. Incredible expensive breakfast, compared with medium prices in Madrid, no way ! Hotel well located, very close to metro line, just 25 minutes from SOL and city center. Nice people at the reception, Jesus over all, really professional and super kind.

Reviews.Title: “awesome stay, clean&cheap”
Reviews.Author: Soniadory
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay @ AC Avenida de América with a friend. There was an offer called romantic february so they brought to our room a bottle of champagne and some chocolates. The room was awesome, very big (superior room) and quiet. There were heaps of pillows, slippers and bathrobe. Plus we booked a little in advance, there was the fashion week but was cheap compared to other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RuiCapucho
Reviews.Content: Good location, nice staff. WiFi could be free of charge in the rooms (it is just in lobby).

Reviews.Title: “Free mini bar, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: S_von_Linde
Reviews.Content: The best aspect is that they offer you everything in the mini bar for free. Some rooms are very modern, others need a refurbishment. Request a newer room. The rooms are clean and the staff is helpful. The location of the hotel is good, because there is a metro station just about 2 minutes away from the hotel. Not a luxury hotel, but a good place to stay in Madrid at a very reasonable price. We did not book, as it is also in Madrid, as everywhere in Spain, much cheaper and more interesting to have breakfast in one of the typical "bares".

Reviews.Title: “Quite a Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Dianha
Reviews.Content: I booked my reservation at AC Avenida after reading about the hotel in one of Trip Advisor's "Best of..." e-mail blasts. I needed something that was close to downtown Madrid without costing an arm and two legs. I have to say, I wasn't disappointed with my selection. First, the good: The rooms have that modern, art deco look and feel to them, complete with hardwood floors, minimal furniture, glass-counter sinks, low lighting, and hunter green marble tile in the bathroom. The wood sliding doors, sporting frosted glass, make the closets -- when the light is on -- the most beautiful I've ever seen in a hotel. The food isn't bad, but there are much cheaper options right in the area. If you want to eat in the hotel, be sure to confirm the menu with the front desk because the offerings change erratically depending on the time of day. I'm not sure if that is due to the fact that I was there in August (the entire city pretty much shuts down for "holiday") and attendance was rather slim. The housekeeping staff does a fantastic job cleaning the rooms. One in particular, Luda, had my room looking like I'd never stepped foot in it. Now, the bad: I don't have very many complaints with AC. The three things that did bother me are: 1) No clock in the room (is that a Spain thing?); 2) The fitness "center" is actually two bicycles, a treadmill, and a weight rack; and 3) Charging 12 euros for 24-hour Wifi in your room (although it's free in the lobby) is a bit ridiculous. That's my take on AC Avenida. It was a pleasant stay, and I would recommend it to those who like the bare essentials with a little flavor. Oh, and if you don't speak Spanish and are in desperate need of help, ask for Jesus at the front desk. He was a God-send.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Extremely Friendly Staff, Very Clean Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: dollsandlace
Reviews.Content: I stayed at your Madrid hotel in May, with my sister.We loved the hotel!! It was lovely and absolutely very, very clean. We really appreciated the cold drinks in the mini fridge each evening when we returned from our day trips. The staff was very helpful, as well. Very well located--a few steps from the Metro Station. Loved the pub across the street, too! You will not be disappointed--our stay was great!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing rooms”
Reviews.Author: IngTL
Reviews.Content: Really great value for really nice rooms. Our room was very spacious, clean, comfortable, safe, quiet, luxurious. Lots of business people staying there so the hotel is posh, but not great for meeting fellow travellers. The staff didn't speak much English and we didn't speak much Spanish so communication was a little difficult, but not impossible. The hotel is not in the city centre, but is very close to 2 metro stations and a main bus terminal where the airport buses pick up.

Reviews.Title: “The nicest hotel we stayed at!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kagome999
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had been travelling through europe for a few weeks and this was our last stop. We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and it was a nice surprise! We were used to staying at some hostels and budget hotels. We booked the hotel based on reviews from tripadvisor and also because of the low price. When we got to our room, our jaws dropped at how nice the room was (we're students and were traveling on a fairly tight budget). I was very pleased with our stay and would recommend it to anyone visiting madrid. Location - this hotel is not in city centre but the metro system is so convenient and well-designed that the distance isn't a problem. There is a metro station about 2 minutes!! It might take 20-40 minutes but once you''re there, everythign else is either walkign distance or a 5 minute ride away. It's pretty close to the airport...about a 20 minute bus ride. The area around the hotel is safe and the restaurants are very reasonably-priced Rooms - clean, comfortable, modern rooms with a FREE mini-fridge (first one that I"ve come across!), and LCD tv. We had no problems with noise. The only thing I was a bit disappointed with was teh staff. They didn't seem very friendly and weren't the most helpful in answering our questions. Nevertheless, this was a very pleasant and comfortable stay and I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price for top quality standards”
Reviews.Author: AnaZurich
Reviews.Content: Quite modern hotel, very well located. Rooms are very confortable, all sort of services available and very friendly and helpfull staff. A very good value for money! The bed is really confortable, only problem was with the blind, which wasn't working on my room, so lots of light coming in in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel, but not centrally located.”
Reviews.Author: TrektheWorld
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice, and clean. It wasn't located in any particular area, but you could walk to a few different metro stops if you wanted to travel around the city. They offered free internet down in the bar area, and the rooms were very spacious. I would recommend this to a friend looking for a safe, clean hotel to crash in, but I feel there might be better hotels that are located in areas that closer to the hip spots.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Manya12
Reviews.Content: My expectations were high based on the reviews on many sites and I was not disappointed. The free mini-bar was a great perk along with clean and comfortable rooms. The rooms were much larger on the back/no view side and much smaller on the street view. The room had very large windows, a nice size closet, and great bathroom and good lighting throughout. Its location in a quiet and interesting non-touristy residential neighborhood (but close to 2 metro stations) made for nice short walks with local stores and bars as destinations. Taxis from the center of the city were no more than 10 euros with tip. A call to the front desk to fix a jammed (exterior) window shade was fixed within 15 mintues. If only husbands were that fast with repairs. My collegues, who did not speak Spanish, were able to communicate with all staff, including the breakfast servers who were helpful and polite to everyone. One collegue left her wallet with cash on a lobby chair and it was returned and held at the front desk until she returned. Lastly, I arrived at 9am and was given my room immediately. This made the difference of having an extra day in the city without having the wear travel clothes.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern!”
Reviews.Author: roby73
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely faultless! Clean spotless, spacious rooms (ask for a corner one, they are even bigger! we had 508) and very helpfull staff! The bathroom is very nice with lots of extras (toothbrush, sleepers, bath robe...) and the minibar in the room is free (including beer!) which is fab in summer. The easiest and more panoramic way to go to centre is by number 1 bus down the road. There are lots of nice cafe around and restaurants. Defenetely a 4stars plus!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: missbimsha
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. The wood work was great. The room was very modern. The bathroom was beautiful and clean. The people at the reception desk was very help. They tried their best to speak english. I noticed a few people comment on the reception staff not speaking english but you must remember you are not in america, you are in Spain. Bring a pocket translator with you. DO NOT vacation in Madrid in August for most of the people go on vacation. A lot of the shops and restaurants were closed. The hotel is in a great location I would definately stay here again but not in August.

Reviews.Title: “Truely worth it”
Reviews.Author: bari_ttc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to the metro station and the surrounding area are quiet. Hotel staffs are very helpful. Room is very nice and the mini bar is free! The room price is very low and the service and quality are very high. What a choice!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Reception Ever”
Reviews.Author: feliz79
Reviews.Content: Upon my arrival i was greeted by a stern woman. I have read some not so good reviews, but the budget was tight but the rooms looked great! The staff don't speak english and i can speak a little spanish but they should try also. The hotel manager which was an older looking woman was just soooo rude! I would never visit this hotel again. The Hotel room i stayed in the windows were dirty, not cleaned for weeks! In house menu is far too expensive. I would give this hotel a miss if i was you! Cold manners better hotels in Madrid than this one. The hotel is in a neighbourhood and you hear traffic all night. plus people living across from the hotel can see into your room.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, terrible reception”
Reviews.Author: HellCat74
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good, in a good location and offering a free minibar is great. Especially when you are visiting Madrid during summer. The rooms are clean and everything looks nice and new. The minus point goes to the reception. I was treated like a dog (or even worse). There is a receptionist who is unfriendly and looks tired of his job or something like that. I have never being treated like that in any other hotel and I couldn't move from there as I would be charged for 1 night. Unfortunately that's the only memory I will bring from this hotel. PS. In other hand I got an amazing service from the hotel security guard. If you have any questions about the town you can always come to him. In fact he should be doing the reception service instead of the ones there.

Reviews.Title: “Free minibar in great hotel”
Reviews.Author: coxjon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, not far from the airport as well as being only a short taxi ride to the bars and restaurants. The continental breakfast were quite basic and not very appitising so ate out after the first one. It is a very modern looking hotel with great, clean rooms. A free minibar is good with extras down in reception to stock up on!! Everywhere is a taxi-ride, but we expected that!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel located near the Metro”
Reviews.Author: wylie31
Reviews.Content: I really like the location of this hotel. It is very convenient to the Metro which makes it a simple trip to and from the Airport. There are a couple of local Tapas Bars in the area that are quite good. If you want to play tourist it is an easy trip on the Metro to get to any area of Madrid. At 7,50 Euros for a 10 trip pass it is a great way to get around. I like the AC properties because there is a standard across all of them that is good. It is nice to know what to expect when you use these properties. There was one drawback this time. The AC properties in Spain have turned off their air conditioning for the winter. This makes the room very warm and stuffy. I had to open the windows - or door in this case, to make the room bearable at night. For this class of hotel, one would expect the air conditioning to remain available irregardless of the season.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel of good standard with extras you would not expect.”
Reviews.Author: PhoebeG
Reviews.Content: The AC Avenida de America is a very nice three star plus hotel. The standard of decor, interior and service is a definite four star. Breakfast is fresh, simply prepared and with some cold meats, cheeses along with hot bacon, sausage and eggs Spanish style. There are also some delicious sweet cakes to have with coffee, such as Apple flan and really good brownies. As soon as breakfast is finished, the coffee bar is opened and fresh coffee, soft drinks, mini croissants and small sandwiches are available all day without charge. This is a very nice extra we have not experienced in any other city hotel. Also in the rooms free soft drinks and beer are provided in the mini bar which is nice. The bedrooms are very good, reasonable space, modern decor. Maybe some spring cleaning of soft furnishings is needed but not a big deal. The beds are really comfortable and with good pillows. Heat is more than adequate and adjustable. Twin rooms are recommended as they are slighly larger than doubles, apparently. The bathroom is very good, spotless and with nice fittings. An excellent shower with lashings of hot water, and nice little lotions, gels etc available. Location wise, this hotel is not in the tourist centre but is about two minutes walk from the metro station Cartegena, and the metro system is super and easy to use. 10 journey tickets are about €6 and can be used on metro and bus. A complementary shuttle service to and from the airport is provided Mon to Fri. I would recommend this hotel for their friendly and professional staff, nice fresh food, good beds and little extras, along with ease of access to the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased in every way”
Reviews.Author: topps61
Reviews.Content: We arrived early morning from out flight from the states and planned to drop off our bags. The friendly staff gave us one of our rooms instead, a nice surprise at 9:30am. Rooms are very modern and clean, with hardwood floors, good closet space, great lighting. The bathroom is marble, with great pressure/hot water in shower. Lots of extras in case you forget something - razor, toothbrush, ect. Most of the staff speaks some english, and were always very helpful. I received a key for a complementary safe deposit box. There is also a small frig in the room with complementary soda, water, and beer. From 11am to 7 pm there is a lounge downstairs with free coffee, cappucino, tea, soda, water, and rolls. A nice touch. The metra stop is about 2 blocks away, and there are small cafes and bakeries close by. This is not in the busy areas, like Sol, but you are able to sleep at night. The beds are great, and the maid service is excellent. The TV has only 1 english channel CNN, but also has bloomberg for market news. We were very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, Tripadvisor scores again”
Reviews.Author: ultrak3wl
Reviews.Content: After checking out other Madrid hotel reports on tripadvisor there seemed to be plenty of positive comments so I booked a Saturday and Sunday night. Like others have said this hotel certainly does punch above its three-star rating. I later spent a couple more nights at a five-star hotel (Palacio del Retiro) in the same AC brand and the Avda. de America being equally ritzy though obviously smaller genuinely did share all the upmarket style of the four-times more expensive establishment. Good: Luxurious fake marble bathroom with bidet and all kinds of little packets containing razor, toothbrush, sponge, lotions, the works. Room decor very elegant with polished wood everywhere and classy illuminated wardrobe. Some nuisance from corridor door-slam but otherwise not noisy. Siemens aircon unit looked new and serviceable although I didn't need it in November, and nice bed (on the firm side) with spotless crisp white sheets. Free minibar, and free airport transfers (Monday thru Friday only so I didn't use that either.) Bad: Not much actually but TV was all-Spanish apart from CNN and they wanted 5 Euros for an hour of wireless internet usage. The Spanish are tobacco enthusiasts and I specified a no-smoking room so was predictably banished to the back of the hotel with a fine view of the fire-escape. Room was slightly on the small side too. I didn't care about any of this apart from the internet stinginess but if TV is important to you then maybe consider elsewhere. On arrival the front desk people were very friendly and helpful - I didn't have much contact with them otherwise but I saw none of the surly attitude mentioned earlier. I think the cause of this hotel's surprising value for money is the location - it is down a nondescript street in a residential (urban high-rise tenement) area which superficially appearing suitable neither for business nor tourism might put some people off. Personally I thought it was very charming having the constant contact with local families walking out with their children and so on. Also it's around five minutes easy walk to the huge transport hub that takes you anywhere in the city fast via their cheap clean safe Metro system. I am not that easily satisfied but at 84 Euros +tax this hotel exceeded all my expectations. I think anyone who could find something wrong is probably the kind of person who would grumble about the free minibar not stocking their favourite brand or something.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Phileas_Mist
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good for 3 stars. Reception advised us to take a twin room for our 3 night stay because they were bigger than the double rooms, but we found the double room to be of an acceptable size. We found the reception staff to be polite and helpful. Their knowledge of English was good enough for the few times we needed any information. The free mini bar in the bedroom, which contained beer, water and carbonated drinks, was a nice touch. Our room had a modern, almost oriental design. The room was clean and the bed comfortable. The bathroom was also good. The only English speaking channel on the TV was CNN which was disappointing. The hotel breakfast seemed expensive so we ate at one of the local cafes. We didn't eat dinner at the hotel as Madrid has lots of bars and restaurants. The nearest metro station is about three minutes walk away. The Madrid metro system is pretty good and cheap. A ten journey ticket cost 6 euros. The hotel provides a free shuttle service to and from the airport. We didn't know about this until we read about it in the hotel. Public transport to and from the airport costs only 1 euro per person but using the hotel shuttle does save carrying suitcases either to the bus stop or metro station. We would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Dunn
Reviews.Content: We were dubious about this hotel as not in the centre and a 3 star. But it turned out to be much better than expected. We personally felt it to be a 4 star rather than a 3. We've stayed in some European 4 star hotels that are no where near as nice. The rooms are large and nicely decorated. The bathroom and the shower especially is lovely and of 4 maybe 5 star standard. It is out of town but it's only a couple of minutes walk from the tube and in total you can be where you want to be within 20 minutes and the tube is very cheap (compared to London). Yes there are no real english channels so overseas business travellers will find that annoying but as a tourist we weren't really interested in the TV. The breakfast is a bit overpriced for what you get especially as Madrid is overflowing with Cafe's. There is one around the corner that is priced for locals. What we found very surprising is that no one really used the restaurant for dinner. The food was lovely and cheaper than the over priced/poor quality food that you get in the tourist areas. Also you get free tea/coffee/soft drinks/pastries all day and the lounge area is lovely and very comfortable. We would stay there again if going to madrid. PS some reviews say the staff are not helpful. Their English isn't great but they were helpful, especially with my Husbands constant need for a iron!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, even for Madrid”
Reviews.Author: deselbys
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days recently: The good: - large clean rooms - 10 minutes walk from Avda de America Metro station - on the east side of town, about 12km from the Airport - limited free mini-bar (1 beer/day....) The bad - staff OK, ranging from reasonably friendly to plain surly - 25 tele channels (all dubbed in Spanish, save CNN. OK, this is Spain, but a consideration for the overseas guests.....) - the cost - about Euro125 without breakfast I expected better for the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay at the AC Avda de America hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just got back from our wonderful stay at the AC Avda de America in Madrid. This hotel is rated a 3 * but I would say it's more like 5, compared to other 3-4 * hotels in England and the US where we've also been. We chose a hotel away from the city centre because we did not want to put up with the noise in a hotel downtown. The hotel is in a nice residential area, extremely safe (which can't be said for many other places in Madrid, specially at night) and a few minutes away from a main Metro (tube) stop. A taxi to town only cost us around €5-6 so we did that a couple of times. The staff were extremely courteous and helpful although it did help that I'm completely fluent in Spanish. They suggested a smoking room instead due to their bigger size and we couldn't have been more pleased. The room was indeed of a great size, the bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was spotless, completely tiled in green marble. The extras are what made this hotel so great. The minibar, full of soft-drinks, was free, and re-stocked every day, there was a cybercafe and gym on-site and a special room with free snacks and beverages until 7pm. The maids were virtually invisible but still managed to get our room looking perfect, including the bathroom every day. The little details like the free tissues, razors, sponges and toothbrushes we got made it all special. Overall, I can't fault the hotel even in the slightest thing. It made our whole stay in Madrid perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a Fantastic City!”
Reviews.Author: KKAustin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous. It is new and clean and the staff is very courteous. The decor is modern decorated beautifully. Each day during the afternoons the lounge has snacks and drinks available. In addition, there's a small refrigerator with water on each floor. The restaurant serves a great breakfast and dinner if you want it. The rooms are spacious and the beds are incredibly comfortable. Also, the television has many different channels, including a couple of English ones for those who don't understand Spanish. As for location, this hotel is very convenient to get to and from the airport. Although it is not near many tourist attractions, this hotel is less than a 5 minute walk from 2 metro stations and there is also a bus station for some trips out of the city. Downtown and other popular tourist attractions are a short cab ride away, and it is nice to be away from some of the hustle and bustle of downtown. I look forward to staying at this hotel again. The staff was so helpful, and when I needed to send a fax back to the US, they sent it for free.

HotelInfo.Name: AC Hotel Avenida de America by Marriott
HotelInfo.Address: Cartagena 83-85, 28028 Madrid, Spain
